author: Matt (Artano)
title: Artano - The NFT Art Marketplace
description: Many NFT marketplaces do not put users first: they have high commission fees, they are hard to navigate, heavily curated and centralized

assessments.note: A NFT marketplace at this point in time is in alignment with the overall goal of driving adoption. However, it appears that many of the criticisms of other marketplaces would apply to this project as well (centralization / high bar of entry).

Problem statement not coherent. The competitors can't be both heavily curated and saturated with art of varying quality. What is the governance process. How are you combining a council or curators yet also democratising?
assessments.reply: from the proposal: The community will later have the power to vote using a governance token. They can replace these members with an entirely new council, or choose to disassemble the council altogether. Furthermore, council members will communicate new features to be developed on Artano to the core team through the community that can later vote on which ones they like the most. In short, the council represents an organized communication and curation channel that drives the development of Artano.

assessments.note: Although many aspects of this proposal are more thoughtful than current NFT market apps for artists, it is still just a mechanism, which would not exist without the artists. So Artists are still grey...their value is as undefined content, as beneficiaries and not as drivers of the innovation. Artist's have local relationships to their community and  unique world views. It may be important to bring ortists onto the team, in the creation of the mechanism, which then may create from the artist up, rather than from the mechanism down, to the artist. Artists often create from unique disjunctures in cultures. These "breaks" in language create unique semantic structures. This could further drive the mechanism you are creating towards something new, and needed.
assessments.reply: We describe the important role of the artist and the council in our proposal ( in the "A Council of artists, collectors and curators" part), the comments are a bit unclear

assessments.note:
Every blockchain is striving to follow the tradition by having NFT marketplace themselves. However there are few marketplace which support multiple payment type.

Proposal is addressing fraud, community over product, open to all and user driven.

User drive been addressed in detail by having council, voting (governance) and how it can accessed to all.

Fraud prevention and detection had not been spelled thoroughly in the proposal. Yes, it is tough to ensure the platform free from fraud. Proposa didn't specific what technology or methodology planned to overcome this challenge.

Unfortunately, the proposal reads more of a list of lengthy promises than a plan. While the team has related experience, it is unclear if they can execute on this proposal. Secrecy is often used as a vanguard for not having a clear vision. How will you handle discoverability? Why has nobody solved it and what will you do about it? How does your solution address its own biases in yielding results to your users?
assessments.reply: This feedback is a mixed bag - they said: "Secrecy is often used as a vanguard for not having a clear vision.", I am not sure what this means and how it's related to the proposal, as we've shown our team, given names, and we've layed out and spelled out our plan in this proposal, including our plans long-term and short-term planning.

assessments.note: Reasonably detailed plan, however governance seems to be a key point and you are not detailing how you will deal with it. It would be nice to have some evidence of the teams capability (LinkedIn profiles perhaps?) Linked Github repo has no code.
No doubt the mechanism could be built. But having no studio artists on the team, (vs graphic designers), it does not seem it will serve artists in a new way.

High level point of view, yes.

Zoom in to the key personnel, there are two developers working on this project. Two developers for such a huge project can delay the deliverable of the project by months.

Timeline for chapter 5 is dragging too long in 2023. In my opinion game should run in parallel with chapter 4. 

Amount requested is too little and only for 2 months?

Understand from the proposal, this is the second time the proposal requested for fund. This time 20,000 been requested for a temporary manpower to deliver the proposal?

While an incremental approach may make sense, assume that the last round of funding is the last round of funding you will ever receive. As there is no monetization plan, how will you survive long enough for this project to come to fruition?

Basis of the project is decentralised art marketplace, yet the decentralisation is pushed to future work. Please describe how this will work. There is a heading legality issues - solved, but the text shows it is a work in progress.  It would seem this idea needs some more work to figure out how it will fulfil its desire to become decentralised.
Yes, they have put much energy into various aspects of building the mechanism.
Yes, objectives been mentioned clearly point by point. Auditing process is easy later to determine the success of the proposal.

solution: An NFT marketplace that is user-driven, open to all and fraud-resistant. We want to build a community, not just a product!
experience: Team of 4 developers, 1 business/financial analyst, 1 designer, 1 content manager, 1 product manager. Built Ethereum and Cardano solutions.
